title: South United FC
text:
South United Football Club is an Indian professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Bengaluru">Bengaluru</a>, <a href="Karnataka">Karnataka</a>, that competes in the <a href="Bangalore%20Super%20Division">Bangalore Super Division</a>. They have also competed in the <a href="I-League%202nd%20Division">I-League 2nd Division</a>, then second tier of <a href="Indian%20football%20league%20system">Indian football league system</a>.
History.
South United Football Club was founded on 16 August 2012 in <a href="Bangalore">Bangalore</a> with the long-term goal of providing a base for youngsters, not only in the city but entire southern region, to take up football as a professional career.
South United roped in <a href="Raman%20Vijayan">Raman Vijayan</a> as the new head coach and in 2013, <a href="Noel%20Wilson">Noel Wilson</a> was signed as their team mentor. They began their league journey on 6 December 2012 in the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Bangalore%20Super%20Division">2012–13 Bangalore Super Division</a>, at the <a href="Bangalore%20Football%20Stadium">Bangalore Football Stadium</a> against Army Service Corps where the club won 2–0 with former <a href="I-League">I-League</a> player, <a href="Gunashekar%20Vignesh">Gunashekar Vignesh</a>, scoring the first ever goal for the club in the 47th minute, ending campaign as runners-up.
South United competed for the first time in <a href="2013%20I-League%202nd%20Division">2013 I-League 2nd Division</a>. They started their journey in the country's second division by 3–4 loss to <a href="Luangmual%20F.C.">Luangmual FC</a> on March 11, 2013. This followed by two 1–0 defeats against <a href="Vasco%20S.C.">Vasco S.C.</a> and <a href="Southern%20Samity">Southern Samity</a>. South United won their first match in the second division by beating <a href="Hindustan%20F.C.">Hindustan F.C.</a> 2–0 on March 20, 2013. The club failed to go further in the league finishing fifth with two wins, a draw and four losses in qualifying Group C.
South United pulled out of second division next season after <a href="All%20India%20Football%20Federation">AIFF</a>'s decided to end financial support to second division clubs. 
The club won their premier victory at Kolhapur with the prestigious Kedari Redekar United Cup by beating Pune FC.
South United were the runners up of the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Bangalore%20Super%20Division">2014–15 Bangalore Super Division</a>.
In April, 2015, the club was taken over by Sharan Parikh, a Mumbai-based businessman.
South United returned to second division in <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20I-League%202nd%20Division">2018–19 season</a>.
Home ground.
South United plays its home matches at the <a href="Bangalore%20Football%20Stadium">Bangalore Football Stadium</a>, an <a href="Astroturf">Astroturf</a> stadium located in the Garden city.
Players.
First-team squad.
 (on loan from <a href="Kerala%20Blasters%20FC%20Reserves%20and%20Academy">Kerala Blasters FC (B)</a> )
